name: In the Matter of Nino V. TINARI
docket_number: No. 895, Disciplinary Docket No. 2—Supreme Court; No. 99 DB 92 Disciplinary Board

judges: CASTILLE, J., did not participate in this matter.
MONTEMURO, J., participates by designation as a senior judge as provided by Pa.R.J.A. No. 701(f).
parties: In the Matter of Nino V. TINARI.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 13th day of November, 1995, upon consideration of the Report and Recommendations of the Disciplinary Board of the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania dated October 6,1995, the Petition for Reinstatement is granted.
Pursuant to Rule 218(e), Pa.R.D.E., petitioner is directed to pay the expenses incurred by the Board in the investigation and processing of the Petition for Reinstatement.
CASTILLE, J., did not participate in this matter.
MONTEMURO, J., participates by designation as a senior judge as provided by Pa.R.J.A. No. 701(f).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
668 A.2d 1112
In the Matter of Nino V. TINARI.
No. 895, Disciplinary Docket No. 2—Supreme Court.

Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Nov. 13, 1995.
